## Go to https://cibersortx.stanford.edu and run CIBERSORTX. You may have to create an account beforehand.
## Remember to insert a name for the column that is the row names in both txt files 
## Upload the signature matrix and the expression matrix. 
## Run CIBERSORTX
## download results
## the W is "CIBERSORTx_JobN_GEP"
## the H is "CIBERSORTx_JobN_Fractions"
## move both files into the /data directory

```{r}
#reads W and H from files and saves as .RData file 
# exp2.CIBERSORT$H
exp2.CIBERSORT <- list()
exp2.CIBERSORT$resultH <- as.matrix(read.delim("~/rnaGinesis/data/CIBERSORTxGEP_Job5_Fractions.txt", header = TRUE, sep = "\t"))
col1 <- exp2.CIBERSORT$resultH[,1]
exp2.CIBERSORT$resultH <- data.matrix(read.delim("~/rnaGinesis/data/CIBERSORTxGEP_Job5_Fractions.txt", header = TRUE, sep = "\t"))
exp2.CIBERSORT$resultH <- exp2.CIBERSORT$resultH[,2:7]
rownames(exp2.CIBERSORT$resultH) <- col1
exp2.CIBERSORT$resultH <- t(exp2.CIBERSORT$resultH)

# exp2.CIBERSORT$W
exp2.CIBERSORT$resultW <- as.matrix(read.delim("~/rnaGinesis/data/CIBERSORTxGEP_Job5_GEPs.txt", header = TRUE, sep = "\t"))
col1 <- exp2.CIBERSORT$resultW[,1]
exp2.CIBERSORT$resultW <- data.matrix(read.delim("~/rnaGinesis/data/CIBERSORTxGEP_Job5_GEPs.txt", header = TRUE, sep = "\t"))
exp2.CIBERSORT$resultW <- exp2.CIBERSORT$resultW[,2:4]
rownames(exp2.CIBERSORT$resultW) <- col1


exp2.CIBERSORT$resultW <- lapply(seq_len(ncol(exp2.CIBERSORT$resultH)), function(X) exp2.CIBERSORT$resultW)


save(exp2.CIBERSORT, file = "~/rnaGinesis/data/alisa_exp2.CIBERSORT.result.RData")

```
